Rapid Bucureşti: Bogdan Ionuţ Lobonţ, Nicolae Stanciu, Iulian Crivac, Dorel Mutică, Mircea Rednic, Mugur Cristian Bolohan, Constantin Schumacher (Narcis Claudiu Răducan 36'), Marius Constantin Măldărăşanu (Daniel Chiriţă 52'), Ioan Ovidiu Sabău, Sergiu Marian Radu, Mihai Valentin Dăscălescu. Referee: Olger Mejías (Costa Rica). Coaches: Mexico: Manuel Lapuente. Rapid Bucureşti: Mircea Lucescu. Cards: Mexico: None. Rapid Bucureşti: Nicolae Stanciu [Y]. Notes: UFC Rapid Bucureşti is a Romanian club. Initially, it was reported that Mexico had played against the full Romania team, and the match was claimed as a full international by Mexico. However, Romanian officials wrote to FIFA to inform them that it was certainly not an official match for Romania. It was then reported by several sources that the Romanian team was a league selection (in fact the team was simply Rapid). Mexico later deleted the match from their official records. 19/01/2000, Friendly SYRIA 0 FK CRVENA ZVEZDA 3 Note: FK Crvena Zvezda is a Yugoslavian club. 21/01/2000, Tehran, Azadi, 45000 Friendly IRAN 5 (Ali Daei 20', 22', 82', Ali Mousavi 44', Sirous Dinmohammadi 46') ASIAN ALL-STARS 0 Iran: Parviz Broumand (Davood Fanaei 46'), Behrouz Rahbarifar, Mehdi Hashemi-Nasab, Nader Mohammadkhani [c] (Sattar Hamedani 46'), Karim Bagheri (Hamed Kavianpour 46'), Sirous Dinmohammadi, Ali Daei, Khodadad Azizi, Mohammad Navazi (Ali Reza Emamifar 46'), Esmail Halali (Abdollah Veisi 46'), Ali Mousavi.
